section.title: Audio
section.p: Music, sound effects a voice data are stored in res/snd and its subfolders.

section.title: Ogg Vorbis
section.p: Vorbis is the only supported audio format. It's technically superior to MP3 and comparable to AAC, both of which have patent issues. Software to convert other audio formats to Ogg Vorbis is easy to find (but be careful when using FFmpeg -- FLAC, not Vorbis, is their default codec for .ogg files).

section.title: snd.xml
section.p: Like image folders, every audio folder may contain a file named snd.xml. This file stores metadata about the audio files in the folder.
The name attribute defines a human readable name for the audio file. If you define a name here and the audio file is used as music, a "Now Playing:" message will pop up with the name.

The start and end attributes are also optional. These are used to define loop points; instead of looping the entire song, only the part between start and end is looped. The part until start is played once, then start â†’ end is looped a number of times, followed by the part after end.
